summary: This is a civil complaint filed by Jane Doe against Ghislaine Maxwell and the executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate. It alleges that Doe was Epstein and Maxwell's first known victim, detailing a pattern of grooming and sexual abuse starting in 1994 when she was 13. The complaint seeks damages for sexual assault, battery, emotional distress, and false imprisonment.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Plaintiff who alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell starting at age 13 in 1994. She is described as their 'first known victim' and a 'guinea pig' for their criminal enterprise.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased accused pedophile and sex offender. The complaint alleges he systematically abused hundreds of young girls, with Jane Doe being his first known victim. He is the subject of the estate being sued.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Co-defendant accused of facilitating Epstein's abuse by grooming and supplying young girls, including Jane Doe. Allegedly acted as an 'older sister' figure during the grooming process.

persons.name: Darren K. Indyke
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor and trustee of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and The 1953 Trust.

persons.name: Richard D. Kahn
persons.context: Sued in his capacity as an appointed executor and trustee of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and The 1953 Trust.

persons.name: Donald J. Trump
persons.context: Identified as the owner of Mar-a-Lago. The complaint alleges Epstein introduced a 14-year-old Jane Doe to him there, with Epstein making a suggestive comment about her.

persons.name: Carolyn P. Hermon-Percell
persons.context: Magistrate Judge of the Superior Court of the Virgin Islands who ordered Epstein's will admitted to probate and authorized Indyke and Kahn to administer the estate.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.context: Attorney from Panish Shea & Boyle LLP representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

persons.name: Benedict P. Morelli
persons.context: Attorney from Morelli Law Firm PLLC representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

persons.name: David T. Sirotkin
persons.context: Attorney from Morelli Law Firm PLLC representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

persons.name: Sara A. Mahoney
persons.context: Attorney from Morelli Law Firm PLLC representing plaintiff Jane Doe.

connections.description: Alleged co-conspirators in a system of sexual abuse. Maxwell is accused of facilitating Epstein's abuse by grooming and supplying young girls.
Epstein is alleged to have groomed, sexually assaulted, and raped Jane Doe over several years starting when she was 13.
Maxwell is alleged to have groomed Jane Doe, acting like an 'older sister,' and facilitated Epstein's abuse of her.
Co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate and co-trustees of The 1953 Trust.
Indyke served as an executor of Epstein's estate, as appointed in Epstein's will.
Kahn served as an executor of Epstein's estate, as appointed in Epstein's will.
Epstein introduced Jane Doe to Trump at Mar-a-Lago. The complaint suggests a familiar, joking interaction between them.

events.title: Initial Meeting and Grooming Begins
events.description: 13-year-old Jane Doe meets Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell at Interlochen Arts Camp in Michigan. They later contact her in Florida, begin grooming her, and initial sexual abuse occurs.

events.title: Introduction to Donald Trump
events.description: Epstein takes 14-year-old Jane Doe to Mar-a-Lago and introduces her to Donald J. Trump, making a suggestive comment about her.

events.title: Escalation to Rape
events.description: At Epstein's New York townhouse, 17-year-old Jane Doe is raped by Epstein after he comments on her virginity.

events.title: Epstein Indicted
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is indicted by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found dead in his jail cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center. The medical examiner concluded he died by suicide.

events.title: Epstein's Will Executed
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein executes his last will and testament at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, naming Darren K. Indyke and Richard D. Kahn as executors.

events.title: Will Admitted to Probate
events.description: Magistrate Judge Carolyn P. Hermon-Percell orders Epstein's will admitted to probate, authorizing Indyke and Kahn to administer the estate.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York City, NY (Epstein's townhouse)
65th Street and 2nd Avenue, New York City, NY (Epstein's apartment)
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York City, NY
Superior Court of the Virgin Islands
keyFacts: The plaintiff, Jane Doe, alleges she was the first known victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, meeting them in 1994 at age 13 and serving as a 'guinea pig' for their abuse scheme.
The complaint details a pattern of grooming, including Epstein posing as a 'godfather,' Maxwell as an 'older sister,' financial inducements, and escalating sexual abuse culminating in rape.
A specific incident is described where Epstein introduced a 14-year-old Jane Doe to Donald J. Trump at Mar-a-Lago, with Epstein making a suggestive comment about her to Trump.
The abuse allegedly occurred at multiple Epstein properties: his Palm Beach mansion, New York City townhouse and apartment, and his New Mexico ranch.
The lawsuit is filed under New York's Child Victims Act, which extended the statute of limitations for child sexual abuse cases.
